title: Galliford Try and Balfour Beatty face £250m legal showdown with Scottish authorities
text:
Two of Britain’s biggest road builders are hurtling towards a £250m legal showdown with the taxpayer over one of the contracts that broke Carillion.

Balfour Beatty and Galliford Try have until December to strike a deal with Scottish highways authorities over the construction of the Aberdeen bypass or else issue legal proceedings under the terms of the contract.

Industry analyst Stephen Rawlinson said: “I can’t see why either party would want to settle.”

The Aberdeen Western Peripheral Route was supposed to cost £745m but quickly spiralled out of control with the final bill well in excess of £1bn after series of delays.

It was originally contracted to Balfour Beatty, Galliford Try and Carillion....
